LINDA HIRSCH: “CUBA: Threads of Hope & Renewal”

January 21 - February 27, 2010
La Galeria at Villa Victoria Center for the Arts
85 West Newton Street, Boston, MA 617.927.1737


This exhibition of photography by Linda Hirsch features beautiful documentary and unique images of Jewish Cuban communities. Over the course of several trips to the island, Hirsch immersed herself in the lives and homes of Cuba’s Jews, revealing rich traditions, cultural affectations and humble settings with stunning clarity & sincerity. Hirsch’s broad ranging portrait of Cuba offers viewers the opportunity to reflect on their own ethnic heritage through images that appear both foreign and familiar. HIRSCH has also created a tapestry of sounds to accompany the visual threads.

OPENING RECEPTION: Thursday, January 21, 6:00-9:00PM
60 images about the essence of "cubanidad" -- family, community, and faith (Jewish and other).

"Shpilkes" klezmer band, Cantor Gaston Bogomolni (Ladino songs), Carlos Averhoff, Jr., Cuban jazz
musician and Cuban conga player, Gregorio Vento will perform at the opening -- Jan. 21 (6-9pm)


ARTIST TALK: Wednesday February 10, 6:00-8:00PM
